reviewText:
30 years before the events of the Ring, it describes the life of 19 years old, Sadako Yamamura (Yukie Nakama), the antagonist of the previous films. In this film, his role shifts to that of a protagonist.

A journalist named Akiko Miyaji, whose boyfriend was a journalist killed during the demonstration ESP Shizuko, in an attempt to gather more information about the past of Sadako Sadako . Meanwhile, Sadako joins an acting company and falls for a member of that group, Hiroshi Toyama (Seiichi Tanabe) only to be tormented by his own psychic abilities (who recalls us to Carrie) and the hatred of the members of the company of others.

As the film progresses, Miyaji soon discovers disturbing truth that the entire company has become "cursed" due to the presence of Sadako, and there is a "second" Sadako, a lesser evil that is responsible for the deaths of journalists the ESP demonstration. On the opening day of the work of the company, one of Toyama's co-workers can help in performing Miyaji recording the manifestation of ESP. Upon hearing this, while on stage, Sadako loses control of his psychic abilities, destroying the stage and kill the doctor who had been his guidance.

The rest of the company (with the exception of Toyama) and then to the bands of Sadako and brutally beaten, leaving her apparently dead. Miyaji then speaks of "Sadako second", and must get rid of Sadako who have known to avoid the second child. Arriving at the old house of Sadako, Toyama revive surprised when Sadako and demands to leave it before it is too late. Toyama, however, refuses, and tries to escape.

After running off a cliff, Sadako is soon overtaken by his "second" yes, and Toyama, and finally kills the rest of the troupe to act. Then come to his senses and regrets his actions. Sadako adoptive father, Dr. Ikuma, decides he must destroy it. That by Sadako drug injection with poison, but she escapes and crawls to the family and backups thereof. She sees Ikuma approached her with an ax splitting wood. She begs for his life, but Ikuma lowers the blade in the head. Ikuma brings down the ax again and throw the body in the dark well. Sadako wakes up to see her lover, but it's just a hallucination. As he realizes where he is, looks up in time to see a rock that slid into place, sealing and cutting her life in her cries.

A well rounded horror film with the main ingredients: it blend the patterns of the narrative plus certain elements related with the Japanese horror tales that may be seen around the great classics (Go for Kwaidan of Masako Kobayashi, 1963).
